review: The parking lot at this location on Friday night is terrible! I would have thought they would open up more parking but the entire back lot was marked off for valet. I looked and looked for other spots, eventually gave up, and parked in the valet area. Oh well. Other than that, I have been a long time fan of Red Robin. Their burgers are fantastic! I ALWAYS get the A1 Peppercorn burger. It's the only thing I  have ever ordered because for me, it's perfection. It's got crunch. It's got all the flavors I could ever hope for in a burger! Just thinking about it makes me want to run out and go get another one today! I just might have to pursue this plan further if my mouth continues to water. Pavlov's syndrome? Anyway, as you can tell by every other review... the fries are bottomless. I did notice that they serve less fries to start with which I LOVE. I used to feel like they gave too many fries at the start for them being bottomless.  All in all, I would rate Red Robin my most favorite burger place in Dallas for their consistency, fantastic flavors, great prices, and generous portions. I love to eat local but Red Robin (even though they are a chain) is really quite impossible to beat.

Red robin =greatness. 1/2 lb of meat any way u want it. Or order one of their specially burgers. Unlimited steak fries. Yes u heard me. UNLIMITED. They have a seasoned salt container on the table if u wanna add more salt to ur liking. Fries come out hot. Really hot. So don't burn ur tongue. they also have garlic fries. Good but not unlimited. For those who do t know what steak fries are. They r like wedges.

I'm gonna make an exception here: constructing a review of a chain outpost. This specific burger-based corporation has a few things going for it: it centralizes around artisan burgers, the fries keep on coming along until you are ready to puke out mashed potatoes, and quality service is really emphasized across the board. I just really wanted to get in for their "summer special", and this was actually my first time at Red Robin--Yummmm. Yeah, that's another fine aspect at this fine institution: a good jingle that pretty much everyone knows. That surely must be why they were winning some rowdy rewards for the "Best Chains in America" last year. A good win always makes for a winning experience. The Fiery Ghost burger boasted ghost ketchup, which was cloyingly sweet and possessed almost no sweetness at all. Let's break down the other components: fried jalapeno buttons and actual jalapenos. I don't know where The Crimson Bird gets these spicy green guys, but they were not spicy in the least. A disappointing burger. One complaint that many people voice here is the actual size o' the burger. Apparently it is on the fringe of being under 4 ounces. I cannot believe they are serving these small puppies at a full-service joint. Moving onto the "full-size." A little better, certainly more pricey--but at least you can customize the "how do you want it." No more than medium... please. But be wary of raw. At national burger eateries, they definitely utilize industrialized meat. OK, the true winner: unlimited fries. These suckers are for sure frozen and fried from the ice box, but whatever. All you can eat. And you get a bottle of Red Robin Sauce. I actually very much enjoy the Tavern Sauce--though it is pretty much like Thousand Island, it does give a nice tangy sweetness to your salt oil-cooked largely sliced tubers. Yeah, yeah, generic review. Red Robin; yummm.

Food is great.  I had the turkey burger. Chipotle sauce was yummy, but perhaps next time I'll ask for light on the sauce since the bun was just a tad bit soggy. Fries are delicious (and they're bottomless). Service is great. My daughter had the corn dog with carrots.  Kid friendly, which is a must for me.
"Juicy burgers and great steak fries

A good veggie burger can be hard to find, so I was seriously pleased to find that Red Robin as two different veggie burger options, and you can enjoy them dozens of different ways with toppings. Guacamole on a burger? get out! Goat cheese, grilled pineapple, fried jalapenos? They even have different breads and tons of sauces to pick from. My personal favorite is always with onion straws and BBQ sauce and whatever else catches my eye, but there are so many combos it can be hard to pick. Order the fries with garlic and parmesan, and keep em coming! They also had a pretty good deal on beer flights which included some local brews. I know it is a chain, I don't care, it was good!

The ambiance is that of a 50's diner, nicely appointed with retro pictures.     My server, Bobbie, was very attentive and made certain my food was to my satisfaction and refilled my drink in a timely manor, along with fresh, hot fries.   I had the "Clucks & Shrimp combo "for the entrée, preceded by a "Jump Start" of onion rings.  All was presented nice and hot.     Over all, a little pricey for a lunch, But the service made up for it.    Bobbie, Thanks for the memories... I will return...

Cool comfortable atmosphere. We were seated and attended to immediately. A nice clean non-sticky booth. Nothing's worse than when your arms stick to the table, or when your shoes feel glued to the floor!! Ugh. Speaking of, thank you for having clean non-food-crusted menus. Our waitress, Bobbi was very attentive and courteous. Our food was served fast, fresh and accurate. Very tasty. We ordered the Chop House burger and a good ol' American bacon cheddar cheese burger. This was our third visit and we're happy to say Red Robin is 3 for 3. The great location,  clean furniture, good food made-to-order, good service AND awesome milk shakes make this a definite Go-to spot.
Pretty good food & really good service.   The steak fries could use some help though.

Not only do I love Red Robin as a chain, I love this location in particular. They hardly ever mess up an order (I come here a lot), but the one or two times they have, they are always very gracious about correcting it. Another point I would like to make about Red Robin in general is, if you or someone you know is a vegetarian, this place is the bomb. You can order any burger however you like it, and they will switch out the burger patty for a Gardenburger or a Vegan Boca Burger. What?!?! That's so exciting! No more awful, bland veggie burgers. My favorite burger is the Whiskey River, but I'm a huge fan of the Burnin' Love and the Blue Ribbon (minus the weird tangy sauce; I think it clashes with the blue cheese). Now, if you are a strict vegetarian or vegan, I'm not exactly sure about their cooking methods, but if you are just a pretty basic "no meat and/or no cheese" kinda person, you will have a blast trying all their burgers. I, for one, have never had an issue with them giving me the wrong patty or my burger tasting like beef.

I love this Red Robin!!!! Of course, Red Robin isn't the best food I have ever had, but that is not the point of going here. If I want a burger, or chicken sandwich at night, but don't want fast food, here is a good place to go to curb the craving. The people here were extremely nice, we came in 30 minutes til closing and left 30 minutes after closing, but we never felt rushed. Our waitress, Brittany, was extremely sweet and talked to us for a long while even though the restaurant was closed. I enjoyed the fries BECAUSE it didn't have seasoning on it. I eat a low salt diet, or try very hard to, and at other competitors places I have to wipe or shake all the salt off and it still tastes like a salt lick. Although other people might like that, I don't. With the seasonings on the side, you can control how much you want. That is a much smarter idea. Also, when it came to asking for gluten free buns, I did not know that they also fry their fries in a different fryer if you are gluten free. Not sure if that makes a difference but it is just a nice gesture. I got their pumpkin spice shake, and expected it to be extraordinarily sweet, but when I received it, it was as if it hadn't been sweetened at all. But, that was nothing to complain about for me because I loved it that way, it was a nice change. All in all this was a great experience, much better than that other restaurant where there is enough salt to preserve you for god knows how many years. Will definitely come back! :)

Been once.. not impressed. .. not worth the money or effort.    I am just not that type that sees the point in a $12 cheeseburger .    Wont go back.    But I knowpoeple that swear by this place.... so maybe it's  just me

There aren't any of this chain back home so the boyfriend convinced me to stop by. We went in late on a Friday, almost eleven at night. You could tell part of the restaurant was closed, but I requested a booth since we had my son and he was already asleep. They were very nice and accommodating. The food was great. The cheesecake was pretty good too. A good experience all around.

Food was middle of the road. The burger patty does nothing for me. The selections are good and what makes the burgers edible. The service is atrocious by all standards. The staff pays no heed of the patrons. As well as the service being more than slow and lacking much courtesy. 2 stars only because the food was edible. Most likely will not return to this location even though it is convenient to home.

Hadn't had Red Robbin in about a year because of the small town I live in. Would definitely recommend this one. Hope you get the same server we got, Junior, because he was stellar. Bonsai all the way! Make sure to get extra napkins.

Man oh man has the quality plummeted. There is nothing gourmet about a burger so greasy it slides all around in your hands. I was covered in grease and my plate had a nice puddle. My fries always come out cold and I always ask for hot fries. This time I got more almost warm fries dripping with more oily mess. Screw waiting for more grease I ate it..  At least the service was okay

The red robin seasoning salt is the best part lol. Good grilled chicken sandwich. Tons of fries. Chocolate shake! Good service. I'm stuffed. Slightly overpriced but not terribly which is why I have 4 stars and not 5

MIL and I met for dinner at 5p and were seated promptly.  Our waiter was great - attentive without rushing us and speedy on drink refills, I opted for the Red Robin Royal, with the smaller burger patty and the egg as it comes, over easy.  I got this great burger served with a small silver cone of fries.  I lifted it is to move it and found out it wasn't a cone but a silver cylinder that held 12 fries....for those who are fry fans, you will be glad to know they still offer free refills, as the 12 fries looked pretty sad. My MIL opted for the Souper Sandwich combo, with a cup of French onion soup and a Caesar chicken wrap.  The soup had barely any broth and was chock full of onions and cheese.  Ok, but not great.  The Caesar chicken wrap was huge....seemed to have perfect flavor and she ate it all! Overall, tasty food, speedy service and a little pricey but it's a niche restaurant that really does most everything a-ok.

I can't even say terrible service, because we never were waited on. I was going out with my family for a celebratory dinner. My mom and I got first and we sat in the big corner booth. The hostess said our waiter will be right with us but didn't give us the server's name. She sat other people after us. Not a single server  so much as acknowledged us. Even the manager on duty looked over at us, saw we had no drinks, and said nothing. After about seven minutes of waiting we eventually got up and left. Very disappointed Red Robin, as I was looking forward to a good burger and beer. Never going back again.

This Red Robin is pretty good.  Last time I came in, we were in a party of 6 and were seated promptly The wait staff was very attentive.  Havent ever had an issue with the food. I usually get one of the Tavern burgers. They always cook the meat just fine and it always tastes good. I actually got my last one "Pig Out Style" which added bacon to the burger and added a bacon aouli. That was pretty tasty.  Had the Bar wings and Yukon Chips. They are pretty tasty. I really like their wings. The sauce is warm enough that its got some spice, but not too hot where you wish you hadnt eaten them later that night.  The Whiskey river BBQ burger is pretty good as well. I like the BBQ sauce on it. Oh and the steak fries are bottomless. The steak Fries are pretty good.

Last time I came here I was near the end of my pregnancy and had morning sickness. So I couldn't really enjoy the food LOL. This time we came in and started out fine. I ordered a Bacon Cheeseburger cooked medium, bottomless fries, and a side salad with ranch. My husband ordered the Royal Robin with an over easy egg and cooked medium well, bottomless sweet potato fries, and a bottomless root beer float. My daughter had chicken fingers, mandarin oranges, and nibbled off my fries. My husband would give his burger 4 out of 5. The egg was under cooked, but the burger was perfectly cooked. I'm normally not a sweet potato fan and yet I LOVED his fries they were incredible. He regretting getting the root beer float, paying almost $5 for a dessert when you get such a large amount of food he figured out the gag lol. My daughter loved her chicken, oranges, and fries. Matter of fact she'd bite into a fry and do a cute "wiggle" dance each time lol. Sadly mine wasn't the best. My burger was perfectly cooked, but it was BLAND. So bland. Turns out the cook forgot to season my burger. My salad was fantastic and the fries were great. They took the entire meal off the ticket when I told them I couldn't think of anything else I wanted and I was getting full off of fries and salad. They apologized and were very nice about it.

Known for their burgers, I wasn't disappointed in mine at all. I ordered the Smoked and Pepper, I think it was called. It was a ciabatta bun with bacon and a delicious BBQ sauce. I split it with my cousin because I'm notorious for never finishing a whole burger. I substituted the regular fries for sweet potato fries and they were fantastic! I am a sucker for sweet potato fries! Thin and crispy, just the way I like them. We also had a small side of Mac and cheese and it was ok. It was American cheese and it just tasted and looked like something from a box to be honest. For appetizers, we ordered the onion ring tower and fried zucchini. Both were delicious. But c'mon - anything deep fried is delicious! I like how they both come with sauces and they're always willing to bring you extra.  For drinks, I ordered the Cookie Dream milkshake and also mooched off of my cousin's mint brownie shake as well. The shakes are very sweet, but I like them that way, so it's definitely not a complaint.  The service was great. Out waitress took good care of us and also had a trainee as well. We had a large group of 9 and everything came out the way we asked it and in an orderly manner. 4 stars for good service, appetizers, shakes, and burgers!

I  went here with my friends and co-workers after work recently. We went straight from work and all got there around 5:45, on a Wednesday and it wasn't too busy so that's a plus.  We all ordered something different, and everyone seemed to really like what they chose. I got the Hickory BBQ Burger I think it was called. It was delicious, only thing I would've changed was added a little more BBQ it was kind of thin and you couldn't taste it too much. And bottomless fries, yep we all took advantage of more fries, and with their seasoning, yep, yep.  Only deal with here is the burgers are really pricy, I mean $10 for a burger, it's a little much. Oh and the French Onion soup was really good too!

How have I not written a review for Red Robin... I should be ashamed of myself. The burgers here are excellent and I love how the fries just keep coming. I really like how casual this place is. If you're looking for a nice place to get your hands dirty while eating a satisfying burger, you have found it. Red Robin has a burger for everyone and every burger comes with endless steak fries.  Burgers: My go to burger is the California Chicken because I love avocado and bacon on anything. However, the last time I visited, I had the Royal Red Robin. I always thought the California Chicken was the way to go for so many years, but I've actually been depriving myself of an awesome burger that just blew me away. I see why the Royal Red Robin is a signature burger because it literally has everything in it, and it's topped with an over easy egg. Yum.  Fries: To accompany a good burger, Red Robin gives an endless amount of steak fries. Perfect consistency to accompany the several different sauces that are available. My personal favorite is the signature Campfire sauce, which tastes like a mild version of Chick Fil A sauce. There's almost (if not already) 10 different sauces to choose from. I also get a kick out of the bacon sauce because bacon on anything just makes it so much better. Bacon in my burger, bacon flavored sauce for my fries.. Can't get enough. Drinks: They have your beers and margaritas, but I have to emphasize the milkshakes here. They are awesome! I had the mint brownie milkshake last time and I loved the chunks of fudgey brownie in an ice cold, creamy mix.  Impossible to leave hungry here. Huge selection of burgers, but if you don't like any of them, there's an option to build your own. Consistent staff and food!

Foods are great but on top of that the server, Nolan takes care of us very well. Giving us lots of fries and very attentive and he even made sure we got the royalty membership so we can get free burgers in the future. Two thumbs up for this red robin!!!

This review is not so much about Red Robin.  The stars are for the service.  If it were for the food, it would be 2.5 or 3, which I don't consider bad for a chain and hence, the 4 stars.  I asked for my burger to be cooked medium and it came out not that way, but still good.  I didn't want to be "that" person on "that" night because it really made no difference in my experience. These stars are for Sam.  Sam is the bartender who took very good care of me when I went to use my birthday coupon.  Normally, servers and bartenders have a justifiable disdain for the freebie guest.  Especially, the freebie guest sitting at the bar not drinking anything but cranberry juice and club soda. The freebie guest usually never tips on what the bill would have been, if at all.  She did not ignore me or treat me like she expected me not to take care of her. Sam was friendly, attentive even to the point of suggesting for and making me a dipping sauce that she personally likes.  The conversation was light, not too much or too little.  This is not any earth shattering review, but in these concepts you never know what you will get in terms of service.  It was just refreshing to get good service.   Go see Sam.  She will take good care of you.

Very friendly place nice people good service. The Food was another story unfortunately... I'm a huge burger fan love them. I'm sorry to say that the burger was not up to par. It was under cooked and very bland. It was flavorless and for the price out was a bit disappointing. I have been there to see if it had changed within the past 5 months but i guess not. I really do want to like the burger please improve the burger.

It is ok but for me it was just a high priced burger place. Cost did not make it better than other burger places,  it cost like $ 10.00 for a burger and frys plus the cost of a drinks. So look at spending a lot and by the way most the burgers are not that big, guess thats why they give you endless frys so you leave full. Oh deserts are good but like $6.00. Bottom line if your on a budget skip here.

I only came here for a to-go and I would say that the wait staff at the bar needed a higher sense of urgency.  And they really don't pay attention, I had to greet them to get their attention. They need to step it up a little there. The food quality was very good as expected from any Red Robin. Haven't dined in yet in a while so I don't really have feedback there.
Wait staff was quick to attention and food was top notch.  The restaurant was clean and the place was busy.  Definitely on the rotation.

I always leave Red Robin Satisfied and full, tonight was no different. I had the "make my own sandwich" meal with a side salad, and a large onion ring tower. The large tower is $9 for 13 rings, while the "shorty" is $5 for 7. I order a crispy chicken sandwich, sesame seed bun, bacon, avocado, barbecue sauce,Swiss cheese, onions, and a fried egg. The waiter advised to get the egg a little more fried than usual, it was superb! The sandwich was fresh, hot, and not sloppy. The salad had the usual veggies, cucumbers & croutons as well, you pick your own dressing. & of course endless steak fries! The wait was 20 minutes, that's great for a Friday and for what seemed to be a consistent flow of big parties. The waiter was super outgoing and friendly, though he slacked a bit on drink refills and napkins. Clean area, not too crowded, and overall good ambience. This spot is good for dates, groups of friends, or large families! Staff is always very helpful and outgoing. Price is around the $10 plate mark. Definitely a regular spot for my family!

Love me some Red Robin burgers. Not only are they mouth-watering delish but they come with endless fries -- now you're speakin' my language. And the milkshakes? To die for. This is a pregnant woman (me)'s dream come true. Burgers are typically priced around the $10 range (more if you add more, obviously) and are pretty big. I end up cutting mine in half and saving the rest for another meal, lol. The milkshakes are huge too; try the chocolate-banana, mmmmmmm. The only thing I'd improve at this location would be service. Visited with a friend on a weekday lunch here and the place really wasn't buzzing with business. There were more empty tables than filled and yet it took quite some time just to get us sat down. Once there, we waited forever-and-a-day for everything (food, drinks, the check).  TIP: Sign up for their "fan" club (free) online and get a free burger on your birthday. You're welcome!

Hunter was our server and kept up great on a busy Saturday. Our kiddo didn't expect buffalo sauce in her chicken tenders so they let her choose a burger instead. The manager brought out the burger and double checked that the issue was settled. They didn't charge us for her first order and didn't make us feel bad for changing it.

This was the first time I went to red robin. It was fantastic. The burgers are excellent, I got the geni-sys. Based on terminator. It was great. The lemonade fusion drinks good. The service was excellent, attentive, and personable. The only thing I did not like was a drink called" Blue Haze". It was just too strong for me. The only reason I did not give red robin 5 stars is because they are not close to where I live and they are not David's burgers, who is close to where I live.

If I could give this location no stars I would. Very slow service and cold food.  Then the manager Kerry out and shrugged his shoulders and asked us what do we want him to do and it would be 20 minutes to redo our order. The was rude. The waitress said he was rude and he bullied all the staff.

First and last time at that Resturant. Cold food and rude management. Our waitress said his name was Cary because he didn't bother to introduce himself and acted put out that we let him know our food was cold after waiting forever for it. She told us he was always like that and she apologized for his behavior. Too many good Restaurants out there to waste time and money at this one.

We have always loved this place.  With then awesome burgers, bottomless fries and tower of onion rings, this place was great!!!  The wait staff has always been attentive and were never smothering.  Rarely had an issues there. I would recommend this place to anyone who likes a good burger.  Go and visit.

This is one of my favorite go-to restaurants when I want to have a delicious burger. My boyfriend and I dined there last night and both ordered the Oktoberfest Uberburger. It was juicy and mouth-watering - absolutely packed with flavor. Our waitress was kind, attentive, and speedy. It was a little crowded, but we didn't have to wait long for our drinks, our food, or our dessert. Can't wait to go back!

Ate their for the first time. The burgers were good but after seeing several cooks and the employees dressing the burgers did not wear gloves. I saw one employee put a handful of lettuce on a plate and give it to a server. I ask our server why they did not have gloves on and his response was " none of the Restaurants use gloves any more"  I was stunned! So he went and got his Manager "Jason" and I ask the same question. His response was Red Robin Restaurants did not have to wear gloves and it's a city by city ordinance. I let him know I have been a General Manager for 12 years and yes in Arlington it is a requirement!  Think he needs to be re trained!

We stopped in on a Sunday afternoon for a bite. The menu is extensive, tons of burgers. They have other things as well. The hubs and I both got burgers and they were really good. They came with free fry refills which was kind of fun. Our service couldn't have been better. We'll definitely be back.

Amazing staff (Jessica N was phenomenal!) and the food was impeccable.  We ordered the Avocado burger, the Whiskey BBQ burger, the curly noodles, chicken strips and a classic cheeseburger with bottomless steak fries.  All left stuffed with no food wasted!  Then they gave my daughter an ice cream sundae and sang to her for her birthday.  A+ all the way!

Excellent service and excellent food! My first experience was not good but the owner contacted me and asked me to return and I am soo happy we did! Our waitress was very nice and very knowledgeable. We never felt rushed and was able to relax and truly enjoy our experience!  And yes the Whiskey River burger was amazing! We will be returning to that restaurant!!!!

Usually the burgers are really good too but this is the second time my well done burger has not been well done. The manager did give us a card for 2 free burgers/entrees on our next visit. Left full of steak fries. Thankfully the fries are always good. Edited: 12/13/15 - so my husband and I returned today to redeem our 2 free burgers/entrees card. I decided to not order a burger. I got the ragin Cajun chicken sandwich. It was really good. My husband got the pig out sandwich. He said it was good but nothing special. It was just a cheeseburger with 2 bacon slices on it.
I love this restaurant! So clean, friendly, and delicious! The GM (Jason) is one of the nicest managers I've met! I will defiantly come back to this exact location!

TERRIBLE service during the day.  Sat in the bar and the server took about 5 minutes to get to us (no big, but should have been a sign) took our drink orders, slammed our drinks down and disappeared for another 10-15 minutes. Had to ask the hostess to send her back because we were ready to order and were on our lunch break of one hour only. She came back irritated, took our order with sass, and left again.(other guests had to go to the bar to order their food from her or ask on the status of their meals also)  After another 10 minutes of no food we asked about it and she said "it's coming. I'll send a manager". Well Jared came over and told us "it's on it's way we have been in the back working on a huge to go order and that's why we have been taking so long" being irritated we dared to ask where our food was after sitting in the restaurant for 35 minutes at this point. We told him it would have been better to have told us that service would have taken longer today because of the large order and let us decide what we wanted to do. He said "well we have a big order what do you expect me to do" and started getting loud with us. I told him I've worked in food service before and you manage all parts of your restaurant and if you need help or can't do that then get another manager. He started yelling at us and we told him he was being unprofessional and he said we insulted him by saying he needed another manager. We told him he was insulting us and that you don't treat customers that way. I asked for the corporate number and he said "IM the general manager" and I said yes but I want corporate and he said "it's at the hostess stand" we told him we no longer wanted our food and we would be leaving, as they had wasted our whole lunch hour ad we had to go.  He decided to make a scene yelling across the bar saying "oh no don't you worry it's on me and I'll box it up for you" as we were walking away.  We stopped at the hostess stand to get the card and they were out and had to go get more. Jud came up and was trying to do damage control because Jared was OUT OF CONTROL at this point. I've never seen someone who is supposed to manage a store act that way because he got offended he can't handle two things at once. Jared proceeded to walk up in between us talking with Jud, who asked what happened and was trying to fix it, and Jared tried to put the to go bags ON US and make us take it, and finally set them on some menus between us and Jud. Jud had to turn to Jared and tell him to walk away. WHO ACTS LIKE THAT? What kind of "manager" acts like that????  The proprietor needs to SERIOUSLY reconsider Jared's role at this restaurant and either do some elaborate retraining with him or just let him go. As far as I'm concerned, this restaurant will fail with Jared because he's too concerned about his ego rather than being in the customer service industry.  ABSOLUTELY UNACCEPTABLE.   And after alllllll of that we still have not heard from the manager or person in charge of that restaurant.  Wow.

For a delicious burger and fries, you should try this place.  I pretty much always get the Whiskey River BBQ Burger.  I have also tried the Fried Zucchini and that is pretty good too.   Not exactly the cleanest restaurant I have ever eaten in but not bad.  I have always had a friendly wait staff and quick service.  They have a full bar and some yummy milkshakes.
I really enjoy this place. Nice atmosphere and staff. Great burgers, and tons of healthy but very tasting alternatives.

My husband and I go here at least once a month.  The service is always very good.    We sometimes get burgers, sometimes we get the fish and chips.  We always enjoy our meal. The only complaint I have is that the bar is NOT consistent.  The first time I ordered a "Fireball Peach Smash" it was SO good.  Tasted like peaches, Fireball and heaven.  I got one on my next visit, a few weeks later... it was an ABOMINATION.  Took one sip and asked the waitress to please send it back and she did so and apologized, but it wasn't her fault.  She did a great job.

The fries were great, as was the service. However, we are currently not eating meat (as many people aren't during Lent). So, we ordered the fish sandwich. It was disgusting! Clearly a frozen patty, and the sauce was not tasty.

We used to love going here with all our kids until we had one ugly experience. We took my daughter that was turning 9 that day. When we ordered we told our waitress it was our daughters birthday. So we ate enjoyed our food and what not. Then our waitress comes with a cake, my daughter get a smile on her face and the waitress goes to the table next to us and sings happy birthday to a person there. Now it wouldnt have been a big deal if the party had been there before us, NOPE they were seated after us. We didnt say anything, just asked for our ticket and left. At that our waitress didnt even give us the ticket. She magically disappeared after the happy birthday singing.

My friend says that he really loves the burgers here, and that's fine. Maybe I should give it a second shot and order a specialty burger in the interest of fairness; however, that chance will be hard to come by after everything I ordered came out mediocre to put it nicely. I ordered the onion rings, a normal burger and this sesame chicken looking appetizer.  The standard that Red Robin has to beat in my head is something like Chili's or Five Guys and that did not happen. They're all priced similarly depending how you order and after that it's just simple economics. For the same price, can a similar or better experience be had? And the answer is no.  But the server was super nice. Unfortunately, super niceness cannot trump disappointing, unfulfilling food.

I love the food.  The service is terrible.  I will not ever ever go back to this location.  It is sad because I ate here like 5 times a month.  Does not matter how good the food is, if the service is bad then you can't change that.  Asked 3 times for a refill for my drink, watched our waitress talk at the bar with the other waitstaff wait on 2 other tables for full meals, then brought me a drink when I finally got my bill.  Normally you like drinks with your diner.  Food is awesome that is what I will miss the most.

2 stars simply because of I love me some red robin food - red robin is pretty similar across the board, regardless of which location you go to.  My issue here was that our service was terrible. We came for a late lunch/early dinner around 3:30 - we ordered shortly afterward but did not get our meal until 4:25! We ordered our beers at 3:55 and did not get them until 4:15!! They were not even busy, there was one or two other tables in our section total.  Anyway, I don't totally blame our server, I think they split his section, even so, it was just bad service all around.

Great place for a burger! I've been here several times and the staff is always friendly but sometimes slow even when it's not busy. You just have a hit and miss kind of day sometimes. The burgers here are great, a bit greasy but not gross. I always order an cheeseburger with pineapple. Amazing! Their onion rings are awesome as well. I will definitely continue going back.

I visit this particular location OFTEN. I decided to visit last night assuming that I would be really good and it wouldn't be very busy. We walked in, and being a party of 2 we were seated fairly quickly. That's when everything took a change for the worse. We waited 20 minutes before anyone even acknowledged us ! MULTIPLE waiters/waitresses and even a manager walked past us without saying a word. At one point, they were all at the bar laughing and joking. After 20 minutes of watching everyone's order being taken a very nice guy came and took very good care of us. Food was okay, if it wasn't for the waiter that helped us I would give less than one star ! More than likely not returning to this location.

Wanted to give this place a try and I liked the variety of different burgers they have since I usually get my burger fix from in-n-out.  I got the turkey burger with a side of sweet potato fries, and the turkey burger was so good! I couldn't almost believe it was turkey.
Service not the issue...the chicken breast they have taste so processed and salty. An onion ring upgrade is $2...I got 5 ....really.
It's our go to place for burgers. Great variety and always well cooked to order. Fries and onion rings are also excellent.

Saw a commercial for their burgers and "bottomless fries" and decided to give it a try.  The restaurant was practically empty but they sat us next to a table of six very loud talking and laughing coworkers who at one point were so loud my daughter seated directly behind them had to cover her ears.  We should have asked to be moved but didn't.  The bench seats were covered in food including soggy lettuce that was hard to brush off.  Table was not clean either.  We waited at least 10 minutes before anyone even noticed we were there.  Our server was nice enough but never checked on us.  At one point she must have gone on break because when she did check on us she smelled like cigarette smoke.   Our food was not so good - soggy burger buns - under cooked fries.  We weren't offered a "bottomless fries" refill and never had our water glasses (which was our only beverages) refilled even though we were there for at least 45 minutes.  Even if we had wanted to ask for refills, our server was nowhere to be found.   We certainly didn't leave the recommended 18% tip the table kiosk suggested.  We did, however, leave a 15% tip which made our crappy experience cost $45.   There are just too many good restaurant choices in Arlington to ever waste our hard-earned money on Red Robin again.  I sure wish Texas Roadhouse was open for lunch.

Had dinner here tonight with my best friend. We were seated right away and our server was prompt with taking our order. My friend got the fried pickles for an appetizer, I forget what they call them in the menu. She said they were good. I got a cheeseburger and she got the Chili cheeseburger. They were bought cooked well and were good. Nothing amazing but a good burger. They both came with bottomless steak fries. (I don't know anyone except for my 12 year old that would really take advantage of bottomless fries.) They were ok, but mine were kinda dry and I don't think they had any salt or seasoning on them whatsoever. Our server cleared out plates as soon as the last bites were taken, and I decided I wanted desert. Only problem with that was he disappeared. Seemed to me like he had tables on both sides of the restaurant....I finally flagged him down and ordered the Mile High Mud Pie. They aren't kidding by calling it that! (See pic). As a "junk " food lover I can tell you it was great!  Also, the restaurant has an "open" kitchen so all the servers tend to hang out where the food comes out for the orders, and it's right in the middle of the place. Which is cool, but I got tired of listening to them joke around (loudly) and sometimes discuss stuff that may not have been appropriate for some of their clientele (not me....but I know how folks are these day). Just something they should keep in mind. Overall, the food and the service were alright. I'd go back but it's not a place I'll suggest if someone wants to go eat.

I am never disappointed when I come to this location. The staff is usually very friendly and if you come at three in the afternoon and the place is usually pretty empty. The weekends are crowded but that's a good thing and my food is always hot and good. Jessica N was my server and a delight.

Vegan here with a non-vegan fam and kids attending. I had the guacamole bacon burger sans bacon and replaced with their boca burger. Yum! Requested open faced but came fully faced. I ate the whole face. Lol. Food was delish all around. Customer service on point. Morio is a top knotch waiter. Great place for kids too.  Definitely a reliable classic.

I love Red Robin. Always one of my go-to restaurants that both me and my boyfriend really enjoy. I've never had a bad experience here until recently. There were 4 hostesses at the front and not a single one looked at us or even acknowledged us when we walked in. Rude! Honestly the waiters and waitresses make up for it tenfold. They are awesome and super cool. Its unfortunate that the people at the front set the tone for your experience but if you can bypass their rudeness, the waiters and waitresses really make up for it. And the food is so delicious!

This was my first time coming to this restaurant and I am so dissatisfied.  The only reason I gave it one  is due to the waitress.  She was great!  Wish I could say the same for the food.  Gourmet Burgers my butt!   Then the place did not feel or look clean.  All silverware was dirty,  we used not one ! I really wanted to like this establishment but it was horrible.

One of the worse red robin experiences I've had, the server and the manager were exceptionally rude and unprofessional. The manager refused to acknowledge the mistake of his server. His feeble attempt to fix the situation did not come anywhere near doing so, never will i go back to this location again.

Red Robin is our "go to" burger place. My wife and I frequent several different locations and have had good experiences at all of them with the food and the service. We love their fried zucchini, fried cheese and jalapeno coins. Many times when I'm in the mood for a burger, my wife will get one of her favorite appetizers. During a recent visit that was the case. I wanted a burger and she wanted fried cheese and jalapeno coins (fried jalapeno slices). Since I've had problems finishing their 1/2 pound burgers in the past I decided to try one of their Taven Doubles. They're a double patty burger and a bit cheaper than their signature burgers. I decided on the "Smokey Jack Taven Double." It sounded delicious and just what the doctor ordered. Our server was very efficient in getting our drinks to us and taking our order. When I ordered the "Smokey Jack" he even remarked that he had tasted it and it was yummy! I couldn't wait. Instead of their famous steak fries, I opted for the sweet potato fries with the spicy ketchup. YUMMY. I'm a "seasoned" restaurant manager. Even though I haven't been in the business for close to 20 years I look at my dining experience from a totally different viewpoint, through the eyes of a manager. Fairly quickly our order was delivered. My wife's appetizer was perfect and my Tavern Burger was just the right size. It was manageable and I wouldn't feel stuffed after eating it. My burger was hot, juicy and delicious. Halfway through the burger, I discovered it wasn't a "Smokey Jack", but just the regular Red Robin Tavern burger. I should have noticed it on the first bite but it just didn't dawn on me. Halfway through eating a burger, I wasn't about to complain and get another burger prepared. Yes, I should have brought it up to the manager in charge, but we were short on time and due at an appointment. I also wasn't out for a free meal. I am sure that there was just a mixup in the kitchen. There was one other strange thing that happened, the menu price stated $6.99 for the Tavern Burgers, but I believe on our ticket my burger was priced out at $7.99. And yes on the ticket, it stated "Smokey Jack." It wasn't that big a deal and I didn't realize the error until I got home and looked at an online menu. I didn't customize my burger at all with any additions so it should have been $6.99. This experience will not deter us from visiting our favorite burger places, Reb Robin. We will be back again soon.

Took my mom here for a burger after a morning of shopping, and boy, was she happy!  She ordered a Burnin' Love, and I got the Whiskey River BBQ. Both of the burgers were delicious, and so big that we could only eat half of our burgers. The fries were delicious as always, and we love that we can order more fries! Red Robin, that is an AWESOME practice! We treated ourselves this time with our drink of choice. Deciding to put calorie counting to the side for the lunch, we both ordered cream sodas! She raspberry and me orange. How delicious! We even got seconds on these. Heaven has to have cream sodas! :) We will be back!
Great experience. Burgers were good, service great, milkshakes are fantastic. Hate to say it but this chain might be taking my burger vote more frequently than Kincaids.

We have been going to Red Robin for years. The burgers & garlic fries are awesome. However, the last couple of times we have been there, the service has been lacking. We waited forever to get drink refills. When we asked for the check, the waitress told us she'd be right back. But about 10 min later we see her standing at the hostess booth chatting. We had to go up there ask her for it again. We will probably continue to come here, but will make sure we are not seated in that servers section.

Really got to give this place some serious kudos! Was there last week and accidentally ordered a burger that came with mushrooms. Didn't even realize it until they brought it out, but I am very allergic, so I asked if they could remake. Totally my fault for not paying attention to what I was ordering, but the waitress was so apologetic and took it back right away. The manager even came over to apologize (even though I told him it was my fault completely) and brought some fries for me to eat while he remade my burger. Great customer service is always expected by consumers but not recognized nearly enough! Thank you to this awesome restaurant, who's always clean, always friendly and always has excellent service and food! To the restaurant manager, you really know how to run a successful business!

Great place to get a burger. I love how they have the build your own burger option. I also love their choice of fries. The sweet potato fries are amazing. The have several different dipping sauces to choose from. Chipotle, bbq, queso, all of them are great. I had a mudslide cake for dessert and it topped off a great meal. I will be back Red Robin!

So came to this dispicable place after a very long hiatus.  It was so long I had forgotten why I stopped coming.  In my mind I loved the fries but the burger was a complete fail. See attached picture. In fact I think it was worse than before the reason I stopped going.  I had to come home and put condiments on my very dry lifeless burger.  The fries were still good and they give you plenty even to go. The restaurant had just opened and I ordered in the bar. It was obviously not clean due to the smell and the flies everywhere.  This was the reason I opted for Togo rather than eating there.

This place is on my families normal rotation for lunch / dinner because it's conveniently located and generally has something that will appeal to all members of the family and with 2 little ones that's not the case with everywhere.  It's also handy to bribe your kids into acting appropriately in order to get a free balloon before we leave.  I know you're jealous that I can still bribe my kids with a balloon.  This age will soon pass so I'm enjoying every second of it. It was hot Saturday so the requirements for lunch with the grandparents was that the place have cold drinks and an AC.  Red Robin fit the bill.  I got the turkey burger, the wife got the Royal Red Robin which has an egg and is one of our favorites and Nana got the "Wedgie" which has no bun and Papa got the veggie burger so we covered almost all the things they have burger wise.  Everyone was very satisfied and due to unlimited fries, VERY full.  Our server while being pretty busy was on point and even found the time to interact and have a playful joking manner, she was great. This place also has some pretty good desserts so if you have the will power to turn down the 3rd (or 4th) basket of fries keep that in mind ( I wasn't able to this time).  Overall a very filling experience with good service.

First visit, the place is pretty nice. Lot of stuff to look at. The bartender, Nicolas was his name I believe, was pretty cool. I got a chili cheese cheeseburger to go, my wife and son got Royal Robins and chocolate fruffles. I grabbed a freckled lemonade while I waited

You know what, the RR in Cedar Hill is typically slow and the staff is generally rude and lacking in desire to help.  The food is usually not great either.  BUT none of that applies to this location!  The Arlington location is fantastic!  Usually a very popular and busy location so be sure you get there with plenty of time to spare if you have a larger group.  We drive the extra distance to go here over our closer location.

We were a large group of 15 and although they don't do reservations, they were able to put 3 tables together after about a 30 minute wait.  Waiting area near the door was large enough for us to visit.  Food was good and so was the service!

Just tried to place a to-go order at 9:16 PM on Friday night at this establishment and was promptly told by the person on the phone that they do not take to go orders an hour before close. The person in the background was audibly huffing and puffing, saying to someone else "are you kidding me?". Would they prefer I come sit in some poor servers section until after close? I am in the industry and if someone told that to a guest in my building they would need to find a new job. We're simply trying to be polite by making our order take out. Instead we will take our business to one of the other dozen restaurants right next door. We "are not kidding you" when we say we will never try to order from your restaurant again. PS both of your neon signs are going out. Maybe if y'all sold some food you could fix it.

So my brother is in town and he wanted a  good burger so we all decided to go to Red Robin. This was an awful service experience. I am in the industry and I understand being busy and getting in the weeds but the way our waitress left our table is unacceptable. The picture I attached is what the table looked like when she dropped our desserts. We had no where to move to eat. It was all building up since appetizers. We accidentally spilled a drink on the table trying to rearrange stuff so we could have room the have dessert.  We moved plates to the side so she could reach to clear it for us but each time she came to check on us she dropped something off but didn't take anything with her. The result was a disaster of a table, with no room for dessert. Side note, I cleaned up the spill myself and asked for a new set of silver be for a fellow server and he rolled his eyes at me and said it's not his table.
